subject: Home & DIY
title: Net-Zero Homes Produce What They Consume
description: A quick win: understand Net-Zero Homes Produce What They Consume.

hook.text: A net-zero home generates as much energy as it uses over a year. Your annual electric bill: effectively zero dollars.

buildup.text: Net-zero combines aggressive efficiency‚Äîinsulation, LEDs, efficient appliances‚Äîwith on-site generation, usually solar.

discovery.text: The home draws from the grid at night and exports surplus by day. Over 12 months, production equals consumption.

twist.text: Net-zero homes sell faster and at higher prices. Buyers pay a premium for zero utility bills and solar assets.

climax.text: California now requires all new homes to be net-zero ready. Other states and countries are adopting similar codes.

punchline.text: Your roof becomes a power plant that pays you back.

quiz.question: What does 'net-zero' mean for a home's energy use?
options: It generates as much energy as it consumes annually
It uses zero electricity from any source
It produces zero carbon emissions during construction
